page.title: 08GEOGRAPHY,ECOLOGY.
page.content: {GEOGRAPHY.} APPLEDORE IS SITUATED ON A SANDSTONE PROMENTARY AS IS READING STREET TO THE WEST.THE SURROUNDING LAND IS FLAT ,BELOW SEA LEVEL AT HIGH TIDE.IT IS EFFICIENTLY DRAINED BY ARCHIMEDIAN SCREW PUMPS AND 'SEWERS'. {LANDSCAPE AND VEGETATION. THE UPLAND IS MIXED GRASS,ARABLE AND WOODLAND.THE FIELDS ARE HEDGED,THE TREES BEING PREDOMINATELY OAK ,SWEET CHESTNUT AND HORNBEAM. THE MARSH IS SILTY LOAM GIVING HIGH QUALITY ARABLE AND GRASS,THE FIELDS DIVIDED BY SEWERS OR DITCHES.THESE PROVIDE GOOD HABITAT FOR AQUATIC PLANTS ,EELS,FISH(ROACH,TENCH,PIKE ETC.),GRASS SNAKES,AND THE MARSH FROG. BIRDS SUCH AS HERONS,MALLARD,SHELDUCK AND MANY WADERS ARE COMMON AND A RECENT INTRODUCTION IS THE MINK.
